pageProps.title: Can sexual kinks and fetishes be harmful to your health, according to a urologist?
pageProps.metaDesc:
BDSM relates to activities that occur between two or more individuals, that include things like administering or receiving intense sorts of stimuli, which may include pain. 

Also including things like authority and submission in between the two individuals and also including arousal that’s associated with certain inanimate objects or maybe even specific body parts.  

Sometimes these activities can also include role play, and it’s described as changing your consciousness or changing your headspace. 

So there’s been a couple studies in areas like Quebec, Belgium and Australia looking at how many people have been interested in kinks like this or have participated in them and how often do they do them regularly.  

And depending on the study, at least half of both men and women have either wanted to participate in a sort of fetishes or BDSM like play. And within that population, about 20% to 30% had at some point participated in some sort of BDSM play.  

And that could be like being tied up or spanking or giving spanking or receiving spanking. 

Being someone who does it more regularly was less common somewhere on the order of 1 to 7%. While very few recognize it as an identity, many people participate in it at some form at some point during their lifetime.
